Description: A large, flat, oval-shaped pendant: of mottled porphyry, bored at the top and slightly chipped near the base. On the chipped surface the stone is mostly black with some grey-white; on the other the grey-white is more prominent.
Curator's comments: The date is uncertain: cf.G. Brunton & G. Caton-Thompson, ‘The Badarian Civilization’ (London, 1928), pl.L, 89D3 (pink limestone), Badarian; A. Scharff, ‘Die Altertümer der Vor – und Frühzeit Ägyptens’, Staatliche Museen zu Berlin, Mitteilungen aus der ägyptischen Sammlung’ V (Berlin, 1931), pl.29, no. 185 (red breccia), Late Predynastic; G. A. Reisner, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1907-8’ (Cairo, 1910), 1907-8, pl.70a, no. 20 (speckled pebble), Early Dynastic.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (143)
